About me


I’m Oskar Grannæs Olsen, a doctoral research fellow at CREATE - Centre for Research of Equality in Education, at the University of Oslo.
I did my masters at the sociology department at the University of Oslo, and then had a year as a research assistant.
I am mostly interested research on education and inequality, but have also co-authored articles with completely different focus.
Check out my CV if you’d like to know more!

title: Oskar Grannæs Olsen
text:
About my PhD
In my thesis, which I started working on in December 2025, I ask questions about how inequality is related to compensation in education. My focus is on the Norwegian context, using registry data and a variety of methods.
In the first paper, I assess how private upper secondary schooling may contribute to compensatory patterns. For instance, does pupils who have previously performed subpar achieve better grades than others by attending private schools?

Please reach out
If you’re interested in working with me, please reach me at oskarg.olsen@gmail.com
